subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.

Content-Type: text/plain;

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Gotcha. Thanks. I do understand what you are saying. It does help to know t=
hese things.

Now how about with analog recorders. How would that work?

  =
----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  =
Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 4:32 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a=
 question.





        Your points seems to be that you can make it work w=
ithout knowing how it works.  So we need to talk about what you mean by tha=
t.

        When you use the microphone, you just speak, and let the record=
er do the rest.  In this case, you are using the recorder without really kn=
owing how it works.   If a spirit can manipulate the EMF field around the A=
toD converter (even without using the mic), then they should be able to do =
the same: just use it without knowing how it works: the recorder does the r=
est.  In neither case do either of you need to know how it works, to get it=
 to work. I am not questioning this.

        But, if they are going to cha=
nge the bits on the actual media themselves, then they must know how it wor=
ks, it order to get all those bit-things I mentioned right.  The recorder c=
an't "do the rest", because by changing the bits on the media themselves, t=
hey are going completely around what the recorder does, and doing the detai=
ls themselves.  And as I said, the details there are very technical, and in=
clude things like converting their words into digital samples of groups of =
a specific number of bits in a specific format on specific places in specif=
ic orders with other specific other bits connected to them like file owners=
hip and dates and such.  It is the job, basically, of a computer, not a per=
son.

        If they are changing the bits on the media, then the recorder=
 is not doing that.  They are no longer letting the recorder "do it", like =
you or they would be if they just used it normally.  The reason you can "ma=
ke it work" without understanding it, is because the recorder is doing the =
work for you.  If they are to change the media directly, then the recorder =
is no longer doing the work, and so they must understand all those digital =
issues.

        So that is the difference between being able to use it wit=
hout understanding it, and not being able to use it.



        --- On Wed,=
 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:


 =
         From: April Abercrombie <april@...>
     =
     Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
          To: EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups.com
          Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 3:11 PM


          =
=EF=BB=BF 

          My point was that they don't need to know how it work=
s for it to work, like my analogy of when I speak into a microphone. I don'=
t know how that works, but it does regardless.

          "And consider thi=
s: if the spirit could make a normal tape recorder record by messing with t=
he EMF field near its mic, and it could make a digital recorder record by m=
essing with the EMF field neat its mic, why would the spirit even need to d=
elve deeper into the digital world: what worked for the analog tape recorde=
r, still works for the digital recorder, so why all the mindboggling extra =
effort for the same result?"

          That's what I'm sayin' LOL! They wo=
uldn't need know and it would still work.


          "Maybe it's that you =
don't know how a digital recorder works?  It really doesn't just dump a lot=
 of "digitals" into a nice neat strip, akin to how an analog tape recorder =
does to tape.  To record digitally takes many levels of processing, and a l=
ot of careful digital choreography on the final media. "

          I don't=
 know how it works. But here again, I don't have to know and it still works=
. I don't even know how exactly an analog recorder works either. I have no =
clue how my voice can be transferred and recorded via electronic means. But=
 again, I don't need to know to make it work.


          But I see what yo=
u are saying and this does make sense:

          "It is much more credible=
 for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF change=
s would have the most straighforward result) than in the digital media itse=
lf."

          I never meant to insinuate exactly how it could or couldn't=
 work, only that true EVP is not created via sound waves in the environment=
. It has to be electromagnetically generated. From this statement is seems =
that's entirely verifiable.

          EVP has been found on analog recordi=
ngs. Would this also hold true for that kind of media?




            ----=
- Original Message ----- 
            From: Rj 
            To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups .com 
            Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 3:13 PM
          =
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


                  If the =
spirit doesn't know how to make it happen, then it's reasonable to assume t=
hat they are not making it happen.  It really does take a lot of know-how.
=

                  And consider this: if the spirit could make a normal tap=
e recorder record by messing with the EMF field near its mic, and it could =
make a digital recorder record by messing with the EMF field neat its mic, =
why would the spirit even need to delve deeper into the digital world: what=
 worked for the analog tape recorder, still works for the digital recorder,=
 so why all the mindboggling extra effort for the same result?

           =
       Maybe it's that you don't know how a digital recorder works?  It rea=
lly doesn't just dump a lot of "digitals" into a nice neat strip, akin to h=
ow an analog tape recorder does to tape.  To record digitally takes many le=
vels of processing, and a lot of careful digital choreography on the final =
media.  \

                  --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@=
abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                    From: April Ab=
ercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                    Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
                    To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups .com
                    Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 1:56 PM


=
                    =EF=BB=BF 

                    I don't think they woul=
d have to know this to make it happen. We already know it happens and I bet=
 that the spirit doesn't know exactly how it accomplished it.

            =
        Sure, there could be another factor that we just don't know about t=
hat makes EVP possible.

                    "It is much more credible for =
the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF changes wou=
ld have the most straighforward result) than in the digital media itself."
=

                    Ok well-there you have it.

                      ----=
- Original Message ----- 
                      From: Rj 
                 =
     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                      Sent: Wednesday, M=
ay 20, 2009 2:24 PM
                      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have=
 a question.



                            Manipulating EMF is one thing. =
 But directly storing bits on a media is way beyond that.  Bits are not sto=
red in a continuous stream.  They are broken into bytes (little packets) th=
at is totally controlled by the processor and software.  For Elvis to "enco=
de directly" to the media, he would have to do what that software does to t=
he digital signals coming in from the AtoD converter: he would have to grou=
p the bits into (for example) 16 little herds each, decide on the specific =
bit interpretation scheme (2's complement?) ,  find space on the media, upd=
ate the media's dictionary of where there is free space and where there isn=
't, link the herds together with some sort of linked pointer, skip around t=
he areas marked 'bad' on the media, update things like date/time modified a=
nd size, respect any kind of ownership permissions on the media, and so on.=


                            It is much more credible for the signal to be=
 manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF changes would have the most=
 straighforward result) than in the digital media itself.

                =
            --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ost=
research. com> wrote:


                              From: April Abercromb=
ie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                              Sub=
ject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
                              To=
: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                              Date: Wednesday, M=
ay 20, 2009, 1:05 PM


                              =EF=BB=BF 

          =
                    "Probably not "directly", since that would mean grandma=
 would have to have quite an understanding of digital encoding, including w=
hich bits mean what, when, and where."

                              Not n=
ecessarily- maybe it is that just by trying to communicate through our equi=
pment, it happens automatically. They don't have to realize that they are m=
anipulating the EMF to make it occur, it just happens. It's the nature of b=
eing of pure energy.

                                ----- Original Messag=
e ----- 
                                From: Rj 
                        =
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                                Sent:=
 Wednesday, May 20, 2009 1:55 PM
                                Subject: R=
e: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.



                                Prob=
ably not "directly", since that would mean grandma would have to have quite=
 an understanding of digital encoding, including which bits mean what, when=
, and where.  But even on a digital recorder, there is still an analog elem=
ent (the Analog to Digital converter) which takes the sound pressure waves,=
 as represented by some analog electronic detection element, and converts t=
hat into digital.  That way, long departed uncle Ebenezer does not need to =
do anything digital.  Under this scenario, if sound is not being heard in t=
he room, but is being induced into the circuitry, then it would be round ab=
out that AtoD converter (assuming it isn't other just plain old noise in th=
e digital elements).  

                                Someone with more e=
lectronic know-how than me might be able to better pinpoint the area in the=
 analog portion of that AtoD pipeline where it would be most likely it coul=
d be influenced by, say, an EM field, and that would also occur in a normal=
 analog tape recorder.

                                 
                 =
               --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh =
ostresearch. com> wrote:


                                From: April Aber=
crombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                            =
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
                         =
       To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                                Date: W=
ednesday, May 20, 2009, 12:29 PM



                                This is=
 what I think true EVP is Eric. Not and actual sound emitting a sound wave =
in the environment, but EMF manipulation in order to imprint the message di=
rectly to the recording media. It doesn't matter if it is analog or digital=
.

                                If the sound that is recorded emitted a =
sound wave in the physical environment, then it is really a disembodied voi=
ce, and not true EVP.

                                ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
                                From: Eric VanDuzer 
            =
                    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                         =
       Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 11:16 AM
                             =
   Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


                        =
        Actually that I would buy into  But the question I have when you sa=
y "tape" are you talking old analog tape or digi recording.  Here is the re=
ason I believe it can be do "real-time".  As you all know we use electromag=
netic Field detectors in field investigations.  If a spirit can manipulate =
that with to show that they are there by giving off a EM field whose to say=
 they can't manipulate a magnetic strip of a tape or even the electronics i=
n a Digi recorder to speak in "real-time".



                             =
   On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 1:01 PM, Kristin Morris <ckmorris95@sbcgloba l.n=
et> wrote:





                                Okay I have another one for=
 you to think about.. I tape a session and review it later..  even a day la=
ter.  Upon review the message that comes over is about something that =E2=
=80=98just happened=E2=80=99 while I was reviewing or happened after taping=
?  Is it possible that spirit can manipulate the recording AFTER recording =
has stopped or even manipulate the audio while reviewing?



              =
                  An give you an example of this I was recording one day an=
d I reviewed the audio the next day.  While reviewing =E2=80=93 about half =
way through =E2=80=93 the message =E2=80=9CYour mother is calling=E2=80=9D =
was found.  I saved it and moved on and within two seconds my mom called.  =
You say it is a coincidence except that I hadn=E2=80=99t spoken to my mothe=
r in over a year.  During this same conversation with her =E2=80=93 we sort=
a made amends and I told her the story of the =E2=80=98secret=E2=80=99 I ha=
d found out about a family member having a child out of wedlock in the late=
 1920s.  Quick backstory.. I found out about this out-of-wedlock birth thro=
ugh my genealogy research and contacted spirit through the box and I was pr=
omptly told to keep it secret and which I promised to do=E2=80=A6



      =
                          Well in this conversation with my mom after not s=
peaking for a year I told her what I had found out.  When the telephone con=
versation ended with my mom=E2=80=A6 I was amazed that the recording had to=
ld me she would call right be fore she did =E2=80=93 even though the audio =
was recorded the previous day.  I proceeded to go back to reviewing the aud=
io and the very first thing I heard was:  THAT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE A SECRET =
=E2=80=93 YOU LIED.



                                Maybe they can manip=
ulate =E2=80=98real-time=E2=80=99 literally??? ?



                       =
         k

roups .com] On Behalf Of April Abercrombie
                                =
Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 11:36 AM 


                                T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com

EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.












                               =
 2 different things happening-that' s why. When you get EVP that everyone u=
nderstands,  it is outward, in the environment. Not a communication through=
 subconscious means.



                                EVP that people swe=
ar they hear, but noone else can make sense, may be a message to them via s=
ubconscious means. That isn't to say that ALL EVP's like this are true mess=
ages, I am sure alot are just matrixing.



                               =
 But then that is how the art of scrying starts-matrixing. Like the Rorscha=
ch tests. The images you matrix with those gives the psychologist an insigh=
t into your mind.



                                By gazing into a dark,=
 reflective surface, you start to see cloudy images. At first, you will jus=
t be matrixing faces in the clouds and not getting much substance. Try it, =
you will see what I am saying. With practice, you start to see clear, conci=
se images.



                                I think that is what happenin=
g with audio as well.



                                We already know fo=
r a fact pareidolia can occur in audio as well as visual stimulus.

                 =
               From: Eric VanDuzer 

                                To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups .com 

                                Sent: Wednesday, M=
ay 20, 2009 10:19 AM

                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC=
] Re: I have a question.



                                yes I understan=
d its personal to that particular individual but why can't I hear it.  I ha=
ve gotten some very personal EVPs through the traditional investigation way=
 (not through a box or anything of that matter) that all others have heard.=


                                On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 12:15 PM, April A=
bercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:



               =
                 "If one person is not meant to hear it they won't hear it =
(I guess I am not quite ready to believe that one right yet)." 



        =
                        I don't know for sure about that one either, but I =
am not ready to discount it either, especially since I stumbled across the =
possibility of audible scrying. But I am sure alot of people don't believe =
in scrying at all either.



                                What makes it =
a possibility to me is that so many people are hearing things that are very=
 personal, but stuff they would not have come up with on their own.





  =
                              ----- Original Message ----- 

              =
                  From: Eric VanDuzer 

                                To:=
 EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 

                                Sent: Wednesday=
, May 20, 2009 10:09 AM

                                Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] Re: I have a question.



                                I think that=
 is the problem I am having though Jim.  When you say "work them over till =
you hear them"  to me I should not have to work them over till I hear them.=
  Yes taking out the ambient and background noise is one thing.  But if you=
 just keep on listening to them with different enhancements you are bound t=
o hear something (matrixing).  If one person is not meant to hear it they w=
on't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to believe that one right yet). =
 I think you all know what I am getting at.  

                            =
    On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdryve@yahoo. co=
m> wrote:



                                Well, for myself...I don't "cl=
ean" them up to much because I really don't know HOW :) (well a little bit)=
Since I've only been at it for a couple weeks. BUT if you can clean up some=
thing to where you can FIND what was there to begin with "you have done no =
harm" I hear alot more than others I guess, and I haven't enhanced many of =
my evp's.*If anyone is able to clean them up...I DO promise you will hear w=
hat I say is correct)Pretty BOLD statement, but if you are able to clean it=
 up with better software (please do for others too) I will be more than hap=
py to "listen" where I made a mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have =
done some DEEP enhancements to a few of my evp's...from the begining I coul=
d only hear clicks and thumps.....but after messing with that area, eventua=
lly I would hear the true voices (and can tell if male or female...approxim=
at e age) and understand the mood also....these where extreamly modified, a=
nd I feel that I could NOT have added enough "simple" enhancements that wou=
ld ADD a voice....full of emotion and distinct syllables :) And some just c=
an't hear them for what ever reason be it equipment that is used to hear (p=
c-headphones- speakers- ears) know one has the perfect match of all these t=
hings. Check out "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" in the files section....work them ov=
er till you hear them. I really can't do much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups .com, Eric VanDuzer <evanduzer@.. .> wrote:
                          =
      >
                                > Now I may be biased to the "inves=
tigation" way of doing things. I do clean
                                >=
 up evps if I hear something and can't make it out do to ambient noise. So
=
                                > hear is my question. When do you stop cle=
aning up? Wouldn't to much
                                > enhancing "tai=
nt" the results? To me the more enhancing you do the less
                 =
               > convincing it becomes. I hope noone finds this offensive, =
it is not meant
                                > to be I am just really cu=
rious. The way I look at it is that if you have to
                        =
        > do so much enhancing to find anything, was there really something=
 there to
                                > begin with. Are we just making =
ourselves believe there is something there??
                              =
  > 
                                > Eric

        <TD vAlign=3Dtop>If the spirit doesn't know how to make it

ear

he spirit

ld: what worked 
                  for the analog tape recorder, still work=
s for the digital 
                  recorder, so why all the mindboggling =
extra effort for the 
                  same result?<BR><BR>Maybe it's that=
 you don't know how a 
                  digital recorder works?  It r=
eally doesn't just dump a 
                  lot of "digitals" into a nice =
neat strip, akin to how an 
                  analog tape recorder does to =
tape.  To record digitally 
                  takes many levels of pro=
cessing, and a lot of careful digital 
                  choreography on th=
e final media.  \<BR><BR>--- On <B>Wed,

     <TD vAlign=3Dtop><BR>Manipulating EMF is one 
                        =
    thing.  But directly storing bits on a media is 
                 =
           way beyond that.  Bits are not stored in a 
               =
             continuous stream.  They are broken into bytes 
         =
                   (little packets) that is totally controlled by the 
    =
                        processor and software.  For Elvis to "encode =

                            directly" to the media, he would have to do wh=
at 
                            that software does to the digital signals c=
oming in 
                            from the AtoD converter: he would hav=
e to group the 
                            bits into (for example) 16 litt=
le herds each, decide 
                            on the specific bit inte=
rpretation scheme (2's 
                            complement?) ,  fi=
nd space on the media, update 
                            the media's dict=
ionary of where there is free space 
                            and where =
there isn't, link the herds together with 
                            some=
 sort of linked pointer, skip around the areas 
                           =
 marked 'bad' on the media, update things like 
                           =
 date/time modified and size, respect any kind of 
                        =
    ownership permissions on the media, and so 
                           =
 on.<BR><BR>It is much more credible for the signal 
                      =
      to be manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF 
               =
             changes would have the most straighforward result) 
          =
                  than in the digital media itself.<BR><BR>--- On 
        =

              =

        =

         =

     =

d 
                                uncle Ebenezer does not need to do anyth=
ing 
                                digital.  Under this scenario, if=
 sound is

 is being

er (assuming it

                                elements).  <BR=
